name: Emerald Bay State Park (lookout)
description: Classic Tahoe viewpoint with a quick stop payoff. Good anchor for a scenic drive day; bring a layer—windy at the overlook.

name: Heavenly Gondola (scenic ride)
description: An easy way to get big views with minimal planning. Works as a midday anchor on a mixed “town + views” day.

name: Kings Beach
description: Wide sandy beach with a mellow vibe—good for families and an easy lake day. Best earlier to avoid peak crowds.

name: Sand Harbor
description: Iconic turquoise water and granite boulders. Great for a relaxed morning with kids; arrive early for parking.

name: Spooner Lake (easy loop)
description: A gentle loop with forest + lake views. Great “low drama” nature time if you want movement without a big climb.

name: Tahoe City (lakeside stroll)
description: Easy lakeside walking, quick snacks, and a low-effort “stretch your legs” stop—good between longer scenic points.

name: Truckee (downtown walk)
description: A solid “warm up / wind down” stop: browse, grab coffee, and pick a simple meal without committing to a big plan.

name: Vikingsholm (Emerald Bay)
description: A short-but-steep hike down to the shore with a unique historic home and big lake views. Plan extra time for the climb back up.
